Which build of 3.0 are you using?
This looks like the work that Core has done on build switching of late.

M7.  I wish you guys had a field for this similar to the "Target Milestone" 
field, or maybe just additional versions that were milestone-qualified.

Can you verify if all of your stack traces are the same?  This particular stack
trace looks like an error occurring during startup.  Attach your entire log file
as a bugzilla attachment if you like.

You're correct;  I didn't notice that this was logged only after restarting 
Eclipse following a crash.  It is consistently logged every single time after 
restarting from a crash, but it turns out I don't get anything in the log when 
it crashes, which I guess isn't too unexpected.  The only other thing I notice 
is that when I close the workspace myself, I get also get the following errors:

I've also started to notice that this problem seems to happen most often when 
I use "Save All".  If I access this action from the menu, it doesn't seem to 
happen, but if I use the keyboard shortcut (Ctrl-Shift-S) it almost always 
happens.

A couple more questions:

 - What does the crash look like... Do you get the dialog saying "VM terminated
with exit code ..."?
 - If this is a VM crash, there may be a VM dump file generated in the working
directory (usually the eclipse install directory).  Look for a new file created
near the time of the crash (the name often starts with "javacore..." or
"hs_err...").
 - Can you paste in the output of "java -version" so we know what VM this occurs
with?

I believe your initial stack trace is just a side-effect of the crash.  It is
safely logged and should do no further damage. I don't know if the NPE in
Tree.releaseWidget is related.

First let me say that it turns out that clicking on Save All from the menu 
does indeed cause it to crash sometimes, just not as often.

I do get the dialog stating that the JVM exited with exit code=1.  However, 
I'm not getting any dumps of any kind generated.

I'm running Eclipse using:

java version "1.4.1_05"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.1_05-b01)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.1_05-b01, mixed mode)

I'm compiling my code using:

java version "1.3.1_07"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.3.1_07-b02)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.3.1_07-b02, mixed mode)
